etymology.description: Pictogram: blood on a knife; originally the graph for 刎 (“to cut”). Later jiajie (假借) for 勿 (“do not”) from oracle-bone times.
etymology.interpretation: Initially depicted a bloody blade referring to 刎 ‘to cut (the throat)’. Because the sound was similar, the graph was borrowed to write the negating word ‘do not’, which became its standard meaning. It is unrelated to the right part of a variant of 利 (𥝢 → 黎) and to 匆.

examples.english: Do not forget your original intention.

examples.chinese: 非工作人员勿入(非工作人員勿入)。
